CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc South Gate?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc South Gate is arc {Harbor Point}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc South Gate?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc South Gate is arc {Grand Terminal}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {South Gate} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Harbor Point} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from South Gate to Grand Terminal in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Grand Terminal to South Gate in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Grand Terminal to Harbor Point in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Grand Terminal and Harbor Point in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Grand Terminal and Harbor Point is {173}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between South Gate and Grand Terminal in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between South Gate and Grand Terminal is {176}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Harbor Point?
SC.A: The total flow output from Harbor Point is {380}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by South Gate?
SC.A: The total flow input by South Gate is {664}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 250? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {325} from {Harbor Point} to {South Gate}, a flow of {404} from {South Gate} to {Harbor Point}, a flow of {339} from {Grand Terminal} to {South Gate}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 250? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {55} from {Harbor Point} to {Grand Terminal}, a flow of {173} from {Grand Terminal} to {Harbor Point}, a flow of {176} from {South Gate} to {Grand Terminal}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 114 and 332? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {173} from {Grand Terminal} to {Harbor Point}, a flow of {325} from {Harbor Point} to {South Gate}, a flow of {176} from {South Gate} to {Grand Terminal}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from South Gate to Grand Terminal or from Harbor Point to Grand Terminal?
NC.A: The flow from {South Gate} to {Grand Terminal} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Harbor Point to Grand Terminal, from South Gate to Grand Terminal, or from Grand Terminal to South Gate?
NC.A: The flow from {Grand Terminal} to {South Gate} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Grand Terminal}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Harbor Point} and {South Gate}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc South Gate, Arc Harbor Point, Arc Grand Terminal}.
